alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 3:48PM AKST until March 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with periods of low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility one mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...From noon Wednesday to 6 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will develop Wednesday afternoon and continue through Thursday evening. The strongest winds and worst conditions are expected on Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop Wednesday afternoon with south winds 15 to 25 mph in passes. Winds will turn northwest and increase to 25 mph gusting to 40 mph late Wednesday night causing low visibility in blowing snow. These strong winds and blowing snow will continue into Thursday. Winds and blowing snow are expected to diminish Thursday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
